The '''Ubuntu Foundation''' is a [[purpose trust]] founded by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] and [[Canonical Ltd.]] to ensure the long-term maintenance of the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] [[Linux distribution]] independently of the commercial activities of Canonical Ltd. Its initial funding commitment is $10M.<ref name="main page">[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/ubuntustory/foundation The Ubuntu Foundation] on ''ubuntu.com''</ref>
+
The '''Ubuntu Foundation''' is a [[purpose trust]] founded by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] and [[Canonical Ltd.]] to ensure the long-term maintenance of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] [[Linux distribution]] independently of the commercial activities of Canonical Ltd. Its initial funding commitment is $10M.<ref name="main page">[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/ubuntustory/foundation The Ubuntu Foundation] on ''ubuntu.com''</ref>
Its current [[advisory board]] is made up of [[chairman]] Mark Shuttleworth, founder of Canonical Ltd., and representatives of the [http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes/council Ubuntu Community Council] and the [http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes/techboard Ubuntu Technical Board].<ref name="main page"/>
Its current [[advisory board]] is made up of [[chairman]] Mark Shuttleworth, founder of Canonical Ltd., and representatives of the [http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes/council Ubuntu Community Council] and the [http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes/techboard Ubuntu Technical Board].<ref name="main page"/>
